floodArea.riverOrSea: North Sea, Stream Dike, Foss Beck

items.message: The flood warning for the North Sea Coast at Hornsea has been issued as strong winds and unsettled weather may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast tomorrow, Thursday 27/10/2022, particularly from 6:30pm to 8:00am and from 6:45 to 8:15pm. The area most at risk is Hornsea North Promenade. Stay away from beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. This message will be updated following the tide tomorrow morning, 27/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Skipsea, Hornsea and Mappleton
items.message: This flood alert has been issued as strong winds and unsettled weather may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast tomorrow, Thursday 27/10/2022, particularly from 6:30 to 8:00am and from 6:45 to 8:15pm. The area most at risk is Hornsea North Promenade.  Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.  This message will be updated after the morning tide on Thursday 27/10/2022, or as the situation changes. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

items.description: Wyre estuary from Fleetwood and Knott End to Little Eccleston
items.message: The Flood Alert has now been removed. However, a further Flood Alert may be issued tomorrow morning for the around midday high tide on 28/10/2022.

items.description: Lune estuary south west of Lancaster
items.message: The Flood Alert has now been removed. However, a further Flood Alert may be issued tomorrow morning for the around midday high tide on 27/10/2022.

This Flood Alert for the Mersey Estuary at Warrington has now been removed. The forecast indicates no current flood risk from high tides and no further impacts are expected. We will continue to monitor the situation and re-issue this alert if necessary.

This flood alert remains in force as a result of high spring tides. We are not expecting today's 27/10/2022 lunchtime tide to reach flood alert level however today's 27/10/2022 midnight tide is forecast to reach flood alert level. Areas most at risk include Coast at North Morecambe Bay from Roosebeck to Carnforth including low lying areas around Ulverston, Greenodd, Haverthwaite, Flookburgh, Grange-over-Sands, Levens, Milnthorpe, Sandside, Arnside and Silverdale. We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 2 days and as a result we may issue further alerts. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated by 17:00 PM on 27/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall
items.message: The flood alert for the Humber estuary from Spurn Point to Winestead Outfall has been issued as strong winds and unsettled weather may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast tomorrow, Thursday 27/10/2022. The particular area at risk is around Kilnsea village. Flooding of low lying land and coastal roads is possible between 6:45 and 9:15am and 7:45 and 9:30pm. Please be careful along beaches, coastal and estuary footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous. We will continue to monitor the forecast closely. This message will be updated after the morning tide on 27/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea
items.message: This flood alert for the North Sea coast at Withernsea, Easington and Kilnsea has been issued as strong winds and unsettled weather may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast tomorrow morning, Thursday 27/10/2022. Areas most at risk include low lying coastal frontages, in particular around Kilnsea Caravan Park, Southfield Farm coastal side and Spurn Road. Flooding of low lying land and coastal roads is possible from 7:00 to 9:00am, and from 7:30 to 9:30pm. We will continue to monitor the forecast. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous. This message will be updated after the morning tide on Thursday 27/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

Tides are expected to be high during coming tides. Areas most at risk include Christchurch Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon. The first forecast high water is at 10:30 AM on Thursday 27/10/2022 with a level of 1.25mAODN with southerly force 4 winds. The second forecast high water is at 10:30 PM on Thursday 27/10/2022 with a level of 1.21mAODN and southerly force 4 winds. A third forecast high water is at 10:30 AM on 28/10/2022 with a level of 1.28mAODN and south-westerly force 6 winds. (mAODN is height above average sea level - for more detail refer to local tide tables.) Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of these times. We are monitoring the situation and will close locks and flood gates if needed. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please be careful along beaches, promenades and coastal footpaths and roads. Consider activating any property flood protection products in Christchurch Harbour. This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 28/10/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: South Cornwall coast from Lizard Point to Gribbin Head excluding Truro City
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

items.message: A tidal surge is expected to affect the foreshore as a result of high spring tides and strong winds. Tides will be at their highest between 8 and 9.30pm tonight. Flooding to roads and farmland is possible at these times, however conditions may apply two to four hours either side of the high tides. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the Wye Estuary from Redbrook to Chepstow. Predicted peaks;- Avonmouth Portbury 7.2 to 7.4m at 8.45pm tonight, 26/10/22 and 7.0 to 7.2m at 9am tomorrow, 27/10/22, Newport 6.9 to 7.1m at 8.45pm on, 26/10/22 and 6.7 to 7.0m at 9am on 27/10/22. Please note there is uncertainty in ranges as a result of predicted gale force winds giving the possibility of large waves and some surge. As a precaution this alert remains in force for this evening and Thursday morning tides. A peak at Avonmouth of 7.73m and at Newport of 7.17m occurred this morning, Wednesday, 26/10/22. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please call 999 if in immediate danger. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 27/10/22 by 11am, or as the situation changes.

items.message: This Flood Alert has been removed. We will continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: South Devon coast from Start Point to Dawlish Warren
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding from the sea has now reduced, however, gale force winds are still forecast, so take care near coastal paths and promenades.

items.description: North Devon coast from Hartland Point to Lynmouth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: Flooding is possible over the high tide on Wednesday evening. High water at Ilfracombe is at 7.30pm, times of high water will vary along the coast. Strong force 5 south westerly winds and offshore wave heights of over 2.4m are forecast to cause wave overtopping of sea defences and sea spray in exposed coastal locations. Expect tides to be around 230mm higher than predicted due to weather conditions. People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast. Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required. Detailed tidal information for those who use it; The forecast high tide level at Ilfracombe is 4.70 mAOD, this is 0.23 metres above astronomical tide level.

As a result of spring tides and strong winds, wave overtopping and spray is expected for Berwick Between Bridges between 15:00 and 17:30 (BST) this afternoon, 27/10/2022. 

We are not expecting any property flooding or to issue Flood Warnings. Areas most at risk are by the estuary, including riverside footpaths and low-lying land on the south bank of the Tweed estuary. Take care and avoid these areas.  
 
We are closely monitoring the situation. 

This message will be updated by 19:00 on 27/10/2022, or as the situation changes.
The Flood Alert has now been removed. However, a further Flood Alert may be issued tomorrow morning for the around midday high tide on 27/10/2022.

items.description: Irish Sea from Hilbre Island to Heswall
items.message: This Flood Alert for the Irish Sea from Hilbre Island to Heswall has now been removed. The forecast indicates there is no longer risk to areas as water overtopping and spray has reduced and no further impacts are expected. We will continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River and high tide levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

The unsettled weather which brought strong winds and elevated tide levels along the south coast has now cleared the area.

The early afternoon tide at Beaulieu (12:04 and 14:24 on 26/10/2022) came in 24cm under forecast.

Over the next few days, the tide level is gradually lowering, and no further impacts are currently expected.

The unsettled weather which brought strong winds and elevated tide levels along the south coast has now cleared the area.

Over the next few days, the tide level is gradually lowering, and no further impacts are currently expected.

Over the next few days, the tide level is gradually lowering, and no further impacts are currently expected.

Over the next few days, the tide level is gradually lowering, and no further impacts are currently expected.
